intro: Deinbollia indeniensis, commonly known as the African orchid, is a rare and endemic species found primarily in the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its unique and intricate floral structure. The plant typically grows as a terrestrial herb, often in shaded, moist environments such as forests or grasslands. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, displaying a range of colors from white to pale yellow. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Deinbollia indeniensis is considered a species of conservation concern.
